title: Wealth Planning Advisor, BMO Private Wealth and BMO InvestorLine (Virtual)
description:
Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Wealth Sales & Service

Job Description

The successful candidate will provide wealth planning, advanced financial planning, guidance and counsel focused on High Net Worth and Ultra High Net Worth (HNW/UHNW) client segments. Incumbent will work centrally, through a national office, in the development and delivery of a client-focused wealth planning experience culminating in a documented wealth strategy. Employee will participate in financial planning analysis, development of high value financial plans and recommendations and presentations for client meetings. They will create awareness of key products and services with the objective of generating increased asset levels from HNW/UHNW investors. Supports the growth and retention of client assets by providing wealth planning guidance to front line advisors through a centralized service model to broaden the dialogue with clients, consolidate assets, and increase revenues. Employee will execute a disciplined approach to all sales and wealth management strategies to support regional and national business growth while focusing on the client experience.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Supports BMO InvestorLine adviceDirect advisors in providing proactive, integrated and customized wealth planning strategies to help clients achieve their financial goals.
  • Develops and presents detailed wealth plans for clients to help meet their financial objectives.
  • Implements strategies to increase the scope of services to help clients achieve their personal goals and to contribute to the overall growth of business results.
  • Ensures that client experience standards for financial planning and client relationship development are met.
  • Acts as a subject matter expert to assigned business/group.
  • Assists in the development of strategic plans.
  • Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy.
  • Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
  • Breaks down strategic problems to provide insights and recommendations.
  • Reinforces sales processes and the client experience by identifying gaps and best practices to ensure delivery of complex wealth plans for clients.
  • Provides insight and expertise on advanced financial planning concepts to include tax, estate and succession planning, philanthropy, and other complex wealth service offerings.
  • Protects the Bank’s assets by adhering to all banking, investment and lending regulations, Bank policies and procedures, legal and ethical requirements and regulations, process requirements, and established risk guidelines.
  • Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
  • Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
  • Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
  • Provides wealth planning expertise and assists in the preparation of wealth plans for clients.
  • Maintains awareness of legislative and industry changes that may affect financial planning.
  • Promotes the use of financial planning strategies to empower sales forces to gather assets, retain assets and generate by-product sales and client referrals.
  • Executes work to deliver timely, accurate, and efficient service.

Qualifications:

  • Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • CFP designation (IQPF in Quebec) or equivalent.
  • Canadian Securities Course (CSC) designation.
  • Life Insurance designation is considered an asset.
  • Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.
  • Strong working knowledge of financial planning tools (e.g., Voyant AdvisorGO, NaviPlan, Emoney, MoneyGuidePro an asset).
  • Strong understanding of financial planning concepts.
  • Bilingual (French/English) is an asset.
  • Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
  • Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
  • Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
  • Influence skills - In-depth.
  • Data driven decision making - In-depth

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

title: Senior Professional Services Consultant (Remote)
description:
Worker Sub-Type:

Regular

 Job Description: 

Location: Open to US and Canada

Today, BlackBerry® is a transformed company. We’re no longer about the smartphone, what we once did for smartphones is what we’re now doing for Enterprise of Things (EoT) – envisioning, enabling, and securing new forms of communication that are connecting the business world in extraordinary new ways. We have the most complete and advanced end-to-end solutions to enable EoT, and our ideas lead the way in the hottest markets like cybersecurity, SaaS, neural networks, and autonomous vehicles.

OVERVIEW

The BlackBerry Professional Services Senior Consultant is a dedicated Elite Technical Analyst resource focused on an enterprise customer’s successful long-term BlackBerry deployment and adoption. A hybrid of Consultant and  Technical Analyst, this role is responsible for overseeing all aspects of BlackBerry’s solutions specific to the customer. Existing BlackBerry product knowledge is critical to the immediate impact of this role.

The Elite Technical Analyst role is expected to stay current on solution-specific technologies, troubleshooting techniques, and upcoming software releases, with a particular interest in the solutions currently deployed and planned for deployment in their assigned customer(s) environment. An ability to set up and troubleshoot lab environments of supported BlackBerry solutions and troubleshoot customer environments will be essential to this role.

The Elite Technical Analyst will need the ability to troubleshoot large complex environments and soft skills to have meetings with decision-makers and technical teams at their designated customers. 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Responsible for the entire lifecycle of the BlackBerry product deployment.
  • Act as the subject matter expert on BlackBerry deployment, products, and configurations for the clientcustomer.
  • Serve as primary liaison to Customer Support Organization, including assist in troubleshooting issues and incidents and preparing Root Cause Analyses if requested by CSO and customer..
  • Develop and present comprehensive analysis and documentation of the customer’s current operations and recommendations for optimal deployment state.
  • Prepare metrics, analysis, and status reports at regular cadence expectations.
  • Leverage available knowledge and skills towards the goal of world-class service in an efficient, scalable fashion
  • Technical aptitude in resolving complex server, mobile application, and/or networking issues
  • Provide senior technical expertise and knowledge of the BlackBerry solutions to BlackBerry customers in pre-sales and post-sales consulting capacity.
  • Ensure Collaboration with BlackBerry Technical Solution Managers, Support, Engineering, and Product Management to resolve customer issues and enhance solution deployment. 
  • Interface with all levels of BlackBerry and be a true ambassador for the customer.
  • Engagement in consultative, deep technical discussions with customers on best practices, capabilities, and configuration to keep the customer engaged, interested, and a secure partner in selling security technologies.
  • Track, document, and communicate solution issues, findings, and configurations
  • Organize Participate in any the Quarterly Business Reviews (“QBRs”) or Executive Business Conferences (“EBCs”), which will involve the Customer stakeholders, the designated Customer contact, and BlackBerry stakeholders
  • Lead new technology and migration planning (UEM-BlackBerry Work and beyond).
  • Assist with understanding how customer’s third-party items can be integrated with the BlackBerry software
  • Assist the customer with standardizing the environment and on best practices to make change management tasks proficient and follow BlackBerry recommended standards.rolling patches and changes easier
  • Ongoing BlackBerry platform design consulting, including high availability/disaster recovery.
  • Plan and oversee server upgrades and new product training.
  • Provide Participate in a CSIP (Customer Service improvement Plan) to ensure that the customer’s mobility becomes as easy to    consume and manageable as possible

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical related field or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • 3-5 years of experience in technical pre-sales, software platforms, or end-to-end IT solution implementation, preferably within the wireless, high tech, or telecom industry.
  • Experience with architecture, design, deployment, and operations of UEM and BlackBerry Dynamics
  • Excellent technical, analytical, and troubleshooting skills, Minimum of four years’ experience as a technical support analyst or comparable role
  • Previous experience in large enterprise IT organizations (e.g., Infrastructure, application development, security, or IT support) is a must
  • Ability to handle and navigate complex high-pressure conversations confidently
  • Demonstrated ability to pro-actively build and maintain relationships at all levels of the organization
  • Ability to articulate and transfer technical knowledge, information and tools to individuals and groups at multiple levels
  • Strong organization, time management, and project planning/execution skills
  • Technical knowledge of firewalls, proxies, Wi-Fi/Bluetooth connectivity, wireless networks, software distribution, asset management, and network infrastructures would be an asset.
  • Experience in MS System Administration, as well as different types of security software and hardware (firewalls, routers)
  • Intermediate-to-expert level working knowledge of MS Exchange (including O365), SQL, Active Directory, and Lotus Domino
  • Knowledge of wireless carrier networks and Smartphones, Tablets, BlackBerry OS/devices, iPhone, Android, and Windows Phone operating platforms.
  • Experience in installing, diagnosing, and troubleshooting server and client-related problems, such as performance problems, permissions issues, and lockups.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Knowledge of enterprise customer business, processes, and goals.

#LI-DA1

#LI-Remote

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

title: Consultant, Finance and Performance (Toronto, Ontario, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Reference code: 105101   
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada 
All Available Locations: Toronto 

Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching

Be part of a firm where you are valued for your unique strengths and where everyone feels a sense of belonging

Fuel your passion for finance and join the best and brightest finance advisors in delivering valued solutions to our clients. Are you in?

What will your typical day look like?

 

Picture yourself as an integral part of a team engaged in providing Finance transformation, performance management, and advisory services to help our clients improve their business. You will analyze issues, contribute to developing recommendations, and construct creative presentations to deliver insightful solutions. On top of this, you will find yourself part of a team of talented professionals who are passionate about putting the client first and getting to the right answer.

About the team

 

We love to help our clients achieve their objectives. The Finance & Performance team has a long history of collaboration and innovation with our clients to offer CFOs holistic solutions to their most complex business issues. We understand the real problems affecting businesses today, and take the perspective of the CFO to understand impacts to their teams, technologies, and processes. We draw on our global network of professionals and industry experiences to tailor solutions to our clients’ most urgent needs. Whether setting a vision, developing strategy, designing the Finance operating model, improving processes or deploying technology solutions, we are passionate about helping Finance leaders improve their operations and achieve their business goals.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

 

You are someone who is:

  • Keenly interested in the world of the CFO, and the dynamics and technologies that enable the Finance function
  • Knowledgeable in financial management disciplines and familiar with some of the technologies that enable the Finance function (such as ERP, IFRS solutions, Robotic Process Automation, performance management, etc.)
  • Able to develop and communicate new ideas and conceptualize innovative approaches and solutions
  • Adept at creating long term business relationships at a senior level
  • Energized by achieving goals in a collaborative environment, and mentoring team members to their highest potential
  • Knowledgeable of market trends, competitor environment, and corporate and business strategies

Canadian travel required with occasional international travel. You should be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments.

Candidates interested in working in Ottawa must be able to qualify for federal government security clearance.

 

Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:

  • You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.

  • You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.

  • You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.


The next step is yours 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? 

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having a diverse colleagues of all abilities!  We encourage you to connect with us ataccessiblecareers@deloitte.ca  if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

title: Planificateur financier
description:
À propos de Solutions financières Groupe Lacoste

Se joindre à l'équipe des Solutions Financières Groupe Lacoste inc., c'est travailler, au sein d'une équipe dynamique œuvrant dans le domaine de la planification financière personnelle et corporative (gestion de patrimoine et assurances). Groupe Lacoste est une équipe de 7 personnes, dont 4 conseillers, qui gère l’un des plus gros portefeuilles de placements avec la Sun Life et dont la croissance nette des actifs ne cesse d’augmenter, les plaçant année après année dans le top 10 des conseillers en gestion de patrimoine au Canada.

Groupe Lacoste a pour mission d’aider les Canadiens à atteindre une sécurité financière durable et un mode de vie sain.

Groupe Lacoste est un cabinet qui se distingue par la qualité de ses services et son professionnalisme. Avec les membres d'une équipe pluridisciplinaire de professionnels, ils offrent des services et produits reliés directement à la finance : planification financière, planification successorale, stratégies fiscales, fonds de pension, investissements, produits d’assurances individuelles et collectives, etc.

Vous connaissez votre profession de planificateur financier sur le bout des doigts et vous cherchez un nouveau défi? L’équipe accueillante du Groupe Lacoste vous attend!

Culture et Valeurs

Notre équipe est déterminée à aider les Clients à atteindre la réussite financière. Nous croyons que, dans le monde d'aujourd'hui, le travail d'équipe nous permet de fournir des conseils de grande qualité au sujet de produits financiers et de services. En choisissant de faire avec affaire avec nous, votre avenir financier est entre de bonnes mains.

Description sommaire

Relevant du Président Directeur Général, le planificateur financier sera responsable de conseiller et soutenir la clientèle selon leur situation financière.

Le Groupe Lacoste offre des services à leurs bureaux du Centropolis à Laval ainsi que des services à domiciles. Le candidat sélectionné doit posséder une voiture, être en mesure de se déplacer et de travailler selon des horaires flexibles.

Principales tâches et responsabilités

  • Évaluer la situation financière des clients afin de les conseiller sur les moyens à prendre pour atteindre leurs objectifs financiers (processus de planification complète, individuelle et/ou corporative, de la collecte de données à la présentation des stratégies et produits recommandés)
  • Offrir une prestation de services soutenue auprès des clients en matière d’épargne et en matière d’assurances vie et d’assurances santé
  • Agir à titre de conseiller de soutien auprès de notre clientèle actuelle
  • Développer une nouvelle clientèle (pas un impératif pour le rôle)
  • Participer à la réalisation de mandats spéciaux.

Qualifications requises

Formation

  • Titre professionnel de Planificateur Financier membre de l’IQPF
  • Titre de représentant en épargne collective (un atout)
  • Titre de conseiller en sécurité financière (un atout)

Expérience professionnelle

  • Minimum de 3 années d’expérience en tant que Planificateur Financier

Compétences

  • Très bonne connaissance de la suite MS Office
  • Excellent français (écrit et parlé) et bonne maîtrise de l’anglais (écrit et parlé)

Habiletés spécifiques

  • Faire preuve de jugement professionnel, d'autonomie et d'organisation
  • Présenter un intérêt marqué en matière de service à la clientèle
  • Aptitude pour le travail d'équipe, dynamisme et professionnalisme
  • Curiosité, besoin d’investiguer et d’apprendre

Parmi les défis du poste

  • Supporter les besoins de plus en plus importants de la clientèle pour permettre une planification personnalisée et adaptée aux marchés et à l’économie en grand changement.
  • Participer au rayonnement du groupe et ainsi poursuivre le standard d’excellence des services
  • Bâtir et entretenir les relations clients en les accompagnant sur tous les aspects financiers en ayant à cœur la relation humaine, les valeurs de respect et d’éthique professionnelle.

Pourquoi se joindre à Solutions Groupe Lacoste

  • Équipe dynamique et très engagée, toujours à l’affût et à l’avant-garde des nouvelles tendances
  • Clientèle diversifiée, stable et bien établie
  • Rôle axé sur la planification financière complète pour fournir au client un service clé en main qui excède les rôles de planification financière du domaine bancaire traditionnel.
  • Flexibilité d’horaire permettant une gestion efficace et optimale de votre temps
  • Culture prônant l’autonomie et la prise d’initiative permettant le développement de vos talents.
  • Salaire, bonification et avantages sociaux concurrentiels à ceux offerts dans les grandes organisations en plus de permettre un équilibre travail / vie personnelle
  • Possibilité de participer à l’équité du Groupe et au plan de valorisation de l’organisation.
  • Prône le développement de l’entrepreneuriat grâce au mentorat de la direction
  • Possibilité de faire du développement d’affaires, mais n’est pas une exigence requise pour le poste
  • Possibilité pour un travailleur autonome ayant sa pratique de faire croître son portefeuille de client

Principal contact chez TALINKO – Recrutement de Cadres

Elaine Martineau – Directrice Exécutive – TALINKO – Recrutement de Cadres – Tel : (514) 912-7679 (direct)

Suivez TALINKO sur LinkedInet visitez notre site web

Seules les personnes sélectionnées pour une entrevue seront contactées. Nous souscrivons au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi.

TALINKO est une firme de recrutement de cadres intermédiaires et supérieurs offrant également l’accompagnement dans le recrutement de membres de conseil d’administration ou comité aviseur. Nous œuvrons dans différents secteurs d’activités.

Veuillez noter que le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

title: Personal Finance Advisor - Assigned Clientele
description:
(Work place: Gatineau, Gracefield)

Desjardins values diversity and equity in the workforce and is committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities by adapting the recruitment process, as needed.

Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

Job Level

NV-07

As a personal finance advisor, you’re responsible for developing and maintaining lasting and trusting business relationships with members and clients, to ensure they’re satisfied.

Your role is to listen to members’ and clients’ needs, offer them advice that fits their financial situation and help them choose appropriate solutions to meet their financial goals. You provide financing solutions for affluent individuals and businesses. Interpersonal savvy is therefore essential.

You drive results by recommending loans and insurance products. You serve as a financing expert advisor and resource person. You ensure that cross-sector strategies are applied to financing and authorize credit in accordance with established rules. You use your expertise to balance member/client satisfaction, business objectives, profitability and sound and prudent risk management.

You work with various partners and experts to design integrated strategies that meet the needs of members and clients.

General Information on the Position

Caisse populaire Desjardins Gracefield, located in Gracefield, serves 5,800 members in a mature market that stands out for its business development potential. The caisse has 15 employees working out of 2 service centres.

The caisse’s assets total $116 million, including $64.6 million in personal loans and $16 million in business loans. Its on- and off-balance sheet savings stand at $95 million.

Main responsibilities

  • Advise members and clients on the best strategies and work with them to identify expected results.

  • Manage business relationships, assess member/client satisfaction and service quality, follow up and identify areas for improvement.

  • Stay up-to-date on the financial services industry, market trends and best practices in your field.

  • Participate in outreach activities and represent the caisse in the community.

Other working conditions

  • Temporary work – scheduled to end on December 30, 2022

  • Number of jobs available : 1

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in a related field

  • A minimum of 1 year of relevant experience

Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered

  • Hold a mutual fund representative certificate – Autorité des marchés financiers

  • For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required

Specific knowledge

  • Knowledge of current financial, economic, political and legislative events

  • Knowledge of analysis of individual markets, business leaders, and the caisse's external environment (e.g. clients, market trends and competitors)

  • Knowledge of tax, financial and succession issues for individuals and business owners

  • Knowledge of all products and services aimed at caisse members and those offered by Desjardins Business Centres, Desjardins components and distribution networks, and those offered by competitors

  • Knowledge of debt management

  • Knowledge of compliance with legislation respecting the distribution of financial products and services

  • Understanding of the philosophy and fundamentals of financial services cooperatives

  • Knowledge of policies, legislation and standards related to products and services offered by the caisse Desjardins business processes

  • Knowledge of service standards

  • Knowledge of techniques used to assess and monitor individual financing applications

  • Proficient speaker, advanced knowledge of English

Desjardins Cross-sector skills

Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning

Key competencies for the job

Drive results, Interpersonal Savvy

Work Location

Caisse populaire Desjardins Gracefield

Trade Union

CAISSE GRACEFIELD (T: 30177)

title: Financial advisor
description:
Job Description


Seeing beyond numbersº

At Laurentian Bank, we believe we can change banking for the better. Founded in Montreal in 1846, Laurentian Bank helps families, businesses and communities thrive. Today, we have over 2,800 employees working together as One Team, to provide a broad range of financial services and advice-based solutions for customers across Canada and the United States. We drive results by placing our customers first, making the better choice, acting courageously, and believing everyone belongs.

This role sits within Laurentian Bank, a subsidiary of Laurentian Bank Financial Group.


Job description
Reporting to the Branch Manager, the Advisor, Retail Services, manages and develops a client portfolio (individuals). The Advisor must develop the loyalty of clients by providing personalized, quality consulting services with the goal to become their number one financial reference.

Responsibilities


Develop sales strategies for specific clients to develop their loyalty.
Meet with clients to help them identify and prioritize their financial projects and goals.
Analyse and evaluate clients' financial and investment needs based on their financial situation.
Maintain and develop continued business relationships with the clients in the portfolio and potential clients.
Collaborate on developing and preparing a branch business plan based on the set goals.
Keep up to date on the products and services offered by the Bank and changes in the industry or competition.
Master and use the latest developments in taxes, products, regulations and compliance.
Perform all other tasks required by the supervisor or required for the job.


Qualifications


Education: A bachelor's degree in administration, finance, or economics
Experience: A minimum of two years of experience in banking or finance
Any other relevant combination of education and experience
License of Dealing Representative of a Mutual Fund Dealer/Mutual Fund Representative/Investment Funds in Canada (IFC)
In-depth knowledge of financial products and services
Sales and negotiation skills
Bilingual


Additional Information


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible work environment that reflects the diversity of our customers and our communities. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including Indigenous people, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability or any other legally-protected ground.

Accessibility
Accommodations for persons with disabilities are available upon request for job applicants taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process.

PIPEDA
We may collect, use or disclose your personal information for the purpose of establishing an employment relationship with you.

title: Financial Services Advisor
description:
Join the Cornerstone Crew!

Financial Services Advisor - Wynyard Branch


Be Part of Something . . . . .

Are you great with numbers, and even better at building relationships? We're looking for a finance-savvy, dedicated Financial Services Advisor to join our Wynyard Branch of Cornerstone Credit Union!

In this position, you'll be an important part of a team of knowledgeable sales people who share a genuine commitment to working with our members to achieve their financial goals.

Reporting to the Manager, Financial Services the Financial Services Advisor creates exceptional member experiences and delivers smart solutions through proactive needs-based sales and services.

This position provides our members, both new and existing, with financial advice and solutions. As a Financial Services Advisor you will be providing service delivery to our members in areas like accounts, consumer investments (term deposits and registered products), consumer lending products and services (including mortgages), credit card and ancillary products, all intended to help members meet their financial success.

In this position, you'll develop solid working relationships with our members and build great team player skills through assisting and encouraging other staff, training, and participating in all areas of your department/branch.

If you're interested in joining our team, you must be committed to working your hardest to retain and expand existing member relationships while also seeking out new forms of business that would help Cornerstone Credit Union grow!


What we are looking for . . . . .

To be considered for this Financial Services Advisor position, you must have a post-secondary education in business; plus, a minimum one to three years of job-related experience including working knowledge of deposit and lending products and services, or an equivalent combination of education or experience. Experience with selling Mutual Funds products is preferred.

You also must show exceptional communication skills, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to build and develop strong working relationships.

A commitment to continuous learning and development is an important part of being on our team as well as taking pride in caring for our members and providing top-notch customer service!


What you will receive . . . . .

Our employees enjoy a competitive total competitive compensation and benefit package that includes matched pension contributions and employment perks that contribute to a healthy work-life balance.

On top of earning a bi-weekly pay cheque, you will also be eligible to receive additional pay for outstanding individual performance through our incentive pay program!

Formal & informal developmental opportunities offering challenge and growth.

The opportunity to be an integral member of a team of professionals in a supportive and collaborative environment motivated to do the best for their team and their members.

This is an in-scope position based out of the Wynyard Branch of Cornerstone Credit Union, and membership in the RWDSU is required. The salary will reflect your experience and qualifications.


We Say We Care, and We Mean It ♥

Cornerstone Credit Union has been named one of Saskatchewan's Top employers for 2022! This is the 6th consecutive year we have received this recognition.

We serve approximately 39,000 members, employ about 280 people, and manage assets of about $2.1 billion.

We are a Cornerstone family; fun, inclusive, supportive, and respectful. Wouldn't you want to be a part of that!

Check out our website at www.cornerstonecu.com

title: Senior Financial Advisor
description:
Description:

The Population Health Research Institute (PHRI), a joint institute of Hamilton Health Sciences and McMaster University, with over 300 employees working directly with 60 researchers. PHRI conducts clinical research internationally in 101 countries and is a world leader in large, global health and population and health outcomes research. Our capacity to conduct multiple international studies concurrently, with tens of thousands of participants in each, is a capability very few organizations in the world can match.



Qualifications:

The Population Health Research Institute (PHRI), a joint institute of Hamilton Health Sciences and McMaster University, with over 300 employees working directly with 60 researchers. PHRI conducts clinical research internationally in 101 countries and is a world leader in large, global health and population and health outcomes research. Our capacity to conduct multiple international studies concurrently, with tens of thousands of participants in each, is a capability very few organizations in the world can match.


As a member of the PHRI Finance team, which provides support to over 50 scientists (“PI’s”) and their network of over 1500 local, national and international researchers for all financial activities required for the conduct of large multinational projects, the Financial Controller – Systems and Reporting is responsible for all development and sustainment of all PHRI financial systems and reporting processes. The financial controller has to navigate the complexities of the multinational research environment, competing requirements of internal and external stakeholders such as the researchers, the industry funders, granting agencies and regulators and the research institute being part of 2 larger organizations (McMaster University & Hamilton Health Sciences), both with unique requirements and processes.

Job Accountabilities:
• Oversee of Financial Systems that uses various tools and systems for its various financial operations e.g. budgeting, variance reporting, investigator fee analysis, accounts receivables and payroll recoveries. The financial controller – systems and reporting will provide oversight for all of these tools and systems and will actively work on improving and consolidating them for maximum efficiency.
• Coordination of Financial Reporting: reporting obligations both to internal and external stakeholders. The data for this reporting could come from various sources and be in different formats. The financial controller – systems and reporting will be responsible for supporting reporting requests (both scheduled and ad hoc) and will strive to simplify and standardize all PHRI finance reporting
• Oversight of Investigator Fee Payments: The Investigator Fee System (IFS) is an in-house system that allows PHRI to pay sites according to the level of data received from the site. Payments are processed on a bi-monthly & quarterly basis, & are sent out via wire transfer & cheque in a multitude of currencies. The financial controller – systems and reporting will lead the investigator fee payment team that is comprised of an analyst and a specialist.
• Finance and Accounting Operations: systems and reporting will also support the PHRI finance department in managing some aspects of the general operations and activities


As a member of the PHRI Finance team, which provides support to over 50 scientists (“PI’s”) and their network of over 1500 local, national and international researchers for all financial activities required for the conduct of large multinational projects, the Financial Controller – Systems and Reporting is responsible for all development and sustainment of all PHRI financial systems and reporting processes. The financial controller has to navigate the complexities of the multinational research environment, competing requirements of internal and external stakeholders such as the researchers, the industry funders, granting agencies and regulators and the research institute being part of 2 larger organizations (McMaster University & Hamilton Health Sciences), both with unique requirements and processes.

Job Accountabilities:

The financial controller – systems and reporting will provide oversight for all of these tools and systems and will actively work on improving and consolidating them for maximum efficiency.

The financial controller – systems and reporting will be responsible for supporting reporting requests (both scheduled and ad hoc) and will strive to simplify and standardize all PHRI finance reporting
• Oversight of Investigator Fee Payments: The Investigator Fee System (IFS) is an in-house system that allows PHRI to pay sites according to the level of data received from the site. Payments are processed on a bi-monthly & quarterly basis, & are sent out via wire transfer & cheque in a multitude of currencies. The financial controller – systems and reporting will lead the investigator fee payment team that is comprised of an analyst and a specialist.
• Finance and Accounting Operations: systems and reporting will also support the PHRI finance department in managing some aspects of the general operations and activities


Monday-Friday - 37.5 hours/week


Monday-Friday - 37.5 hours/week


1. Bachelor's degree in Business or finance or equivalent.
2. Designation as a Canadian Chartered Professional Accountant.
3. Minimum 10 years’ of financial/accounting experience, and 5 years of management.
4. Understanding of Contractual language required.
5. Highly Proficient with use of internal technology (Meditech, Budget Reporting Tool).
6. Demonstrated excellence in communication and team building with the ability to initiate and
model positive change.
7. Ability to maintain a high degree of accuracy & attention to detail.
8. Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel, Word and Access.
9. High level of initiative and self-directive.

As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to Employee Health Services.


1. Bachelor's degree in Business or finance or equivalent.
2. Designation as a Canadian Chartered Professional Accountant.
3. Minimum 10 years’ of financial/accounting experience, and 5 years of management.
4. Understanding of Contractual language required.
5. Highly Proficient with use of internal technology (Meditech, Budget Reporting Tool).
6. Demonstrated excellence in communication and team building with the ability to initiate and
model positive change.
7. Ability to maintain a high degree of accuracy & attention to detail.
8. Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel, Word and Access.
9. High level of initiative and self-directive.

As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to Employee Health Services.


Hamilton Health Sciences fosters a culture of patient and staff safety, whereby all employees are guided by our Mission, Vision, Values, and Values Based Code of Conduct. Hamilton Health Sciences is a teaching hospital and all staff and physicians are expected to support students and other learners.

To be considered for this opportunity applicants must apply during the posting period. All internal and external applicants may ONLY apply via the Careers website.

Hamilton Health Sciences is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate any needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact HR Operations at 905-521-2100, Ext. 46947 for assistance. If the applicant requires a specific accommodation because of a disability during an interview, the applicant will need to advise the hiring manager when scheduling the interview and the appropriate accommodations can be made.

This competition is open to all qualified applicants, however, qualified internal applicants will be considered first. Past performance will be considered as part of the selection process. If you are a previous employee of Hamilton Health Sciences, please note: the circumstances around an employee's exit will be considered prior to an offer of employment

Proficiency in both Official Languages, French and English, is considered an asset

If this position is temporary, selection for this position will be as per the outlined Collective Agreements:

Article 30 (k), CUPE Collective Agreement

Article 10.7 (d), ONA Collective Agreement

Article 13.01 (b) (ii), OPSEU 273 Collective Agreement

Article 14.04, OPSEU 209 Collective Agreement

Article 2.07 and Article 13, PIPSC RT Collective Agreement

title: Advisor Associate, Wealth Solutions
description:
Do you thrive in a fast-paced, professional and fun environment? Are you looking for a place to showcase your client relationship skills? Do you have an entrepreneurial mindset? If so, we're growing and seeking passionate, energetic and determined people to join our Wealth Solutions team! Skyline's Head Office is located in Guelph, ON.

Job description

The Advisor Service, Wealth Solutions will utilize their strong relationship management skills and experience to create referral sources for new investors as well as manage existing investors, while supporting Skylineâ€™s shared goal of creating meaningful value and an exceptional experience for our customers, our people and our communities.

What you will be doing:

  • Prospecting new leads generated by marketing
  • Develop new investor lead sources and centers of influence using Sales Navigator.
  • Maintain relationships with existing top tier clients and/or high referral sources with regular investor communications and in person meetings when applicable.
  • Develop relationships with discretionary fee based Investment Advisors and Independent dealer member firms in order to wholesale our products.
  • Provide reliable and timely information to current and prospective investors and support prospective and existing investors.
  • Provide client support to maintain excellent customer satisfaction.

What we look for:

  • Passion - for investment management, finance and economics.
  • Professionalism - it means so many things, but to us it's about taking pride in the quality of service we provide to our customers.
  • Personality - you're the individual with a great sense of humour that everyone wants to talk to! Not only do you know how to make a positive first impression, you know how to make it last. 
  • Drive - you're a seasoned traveler who knows that being in front of an investor is one of the best ways to communicate. Youâ€™re also not afraid to pick up the phone or present to an audience. 
  • Diligence - you understand that being thorough is crucial when tracking sales activities and you have experience with Client Relationship Management (CRM) tools like Salesforce.
  • Knowledge - of exempt market investments and proven experience in providing financial advice. You also have the ability to problem solve and plan effectively and independently.
  • Experience - at least 3 years related investment management experience.  
  • Education - a University Degree (Business, Economics, Accounting, Finance), completion of Canadian Securities course, CIM/CFA designations preferred and the ability to meet all regulatory requirements to be registered as a Dealing Representative for an Exempt Market Dealer.

Why you want to work here:

  • You are the epitome of a people person and much like your humble demeanor, providing excellent customer service comes second nature to you.
  • Relationships are important to you and you know how to build trust especially over the phone and face to face.
  • You are eager to help build a business you believe in and fiercely driven to make your mark in a competitive industry.
  • You get a thrill from working with a great team and enjoy collaborating with others.
  • Schmoozing is fun for you and sharing your love of our exempt market products with others is why you get out of bed in the morning.
  • Working for a growing company that supports environmental stewardship and social responsibilities is a must for you.
  • You want to work for an employer that supports work-life balance and truly cares that you are fulfilled in your life.

The Skyline Group of Companies is a fully integrated investment management organization: grounded in real estate, powered by people, and growing for the future. Every aspect of Skyline is managed with the utmost care and attention to detail, from consulting with investors to fostering a sense of community at each and every one of its properties.

We offer our employees a competitive base salary monthly commissions, benefits, paid volunteer day, group RSP, on-going training, growth potential and so much more. Our workplace culture empowers staff at all levels to become involved in supporting and building vibrant communities.

Join Skyline - Grounded in real estate. Powered by people. Growing for the future!

title: Financial Consultant
description:
Join us at SRED.io - an industry-leading SaaS platform designed to automate research and development tax credit-based financing for our clients.

We're looking for an energetic, confident, bright, detail-oriented, self-motivated multi-tasking professional with exceptional extraordinary communication skills to join our team.

About the Opportunity:

We currently have a unique opportunity for a bright, assertive and focused Financial Consultant to join our team of high caliber professionals.

In this role, you will be responsible for the collection and preparation of all financial aspects of the SR&ED claims process. Our client base includes a variety of premier corporate leaders in the software and manufacturing arenas. This is an excellent opportunity for a sharp, detailed oriented individual who enjoys client interaction and thrives in a dynamic and professional environment.

As a Financial Consultant, you will:
  • Interface with the finance departments at technology / manufacturing companies conducting leading edge Scientific Research & Experimental Development (SR&ED) activities.
  • Interact with peers, clients, Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) representatives supporting & building SRED.io’s client base
  • Analyze of financial information and preparation of the R&D cost schedules
  • Monitor the entire process from claim until contribution.
All about you:
  • Familiarity with SR&ED or other tax programs
  • Graduate of in Engineering, Mathematics, or Accounting from a post-secondary institution
  • Quick learner – ability to research and understand tax regulations surrounding SR&ED and related tax implications

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Full benefits, including vision, dental, medical, and access to full-service remote doctors through Maple
  • Remote or in-office work based on your own preferences

Apply today and join our team!

title: Financial Planner
description:
Location: Winnipeg, MB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 2/3/2022Job ID: 9A84311723Category: Accounting & Finance
If you are a talented and experienced Financial Planner, David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you! Our Winnipeg based client has partnered with Angela Degelman, Partner, to lead their next search.

Our client prides themselves on taking a comprehensive and creative approach to meet the needs of their clients, they handle everything with respect to investment and holistic planning. To be successful in this role, you must have an excellent understanding of financial services and products and have the superb relationship-building ability and continuously put client needs first. On top of that, you must be open to having fun at work!!

Responsibilities:
  • Maintain client base; recognize new opportunities for growth within each client’s portfolio
  • Able to prospect and create new relationships as part of business development
  • Provide clients with personalized financial options, specific to their needs
  • Provide knowledgeable financial advice and services to clients, helping them to achieve their financial goals
  • Help build and maintain our clients brand as being a premier financial institution by providing exceptional customer care
  • Be an active contributor to the effective functioning of the team and the incredible company culture that we are very proud of

Qualifications:
  • Excellent knowledge of financial products and services; excellent analytical ability and critical thinking skills
  • Entrepreneurial approach
  • Natural sales inclination and ability to successfully foster and maintain client relationships
  • Driven and proactive, with a 'go-getter' attitude
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proven track record of sales; results-driven
  • Minimum 4+ years experience in financial planning/financial advising
  • Completion of CSC
  • University degree in Business Administration, Commerce, or equivalent
  • Able to register with industry regulators
  • Possess, or are able to obtain courses such as Conduct and Practices Handbook (CPH), Professional Financial Planning Course (PFPC), or Wealth Management Essential Course (WME), the CFP designation, and Life Licensing Qualification Program (LLQP)

Job ID: 9A84311723

If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Associate Financial Advisor - Goderich
description:
Our Distribution team aspires to be the leader in client engagement among Canadian Insurers. We strive to provide a seamless and personalized client experience. Our knowledgeable and trusted team is committed to delivering financial services solutions to meet our clients' unique needs. The Associate Financial Advisor plays a key role in supporting and developing agency operations through outbound prospecting, client contact and sales activities. This role may have an opportunity to specialize in one or more product areas such as life, group and wealth. The Associate Financial Advisor will identify prospects in both personal and business markets, determine needs and as a trusted Associate Advisor, make informed product recommendations. They may also be involved in the development and growth of personal lines products (home/auto insurance) and specialty lines (farm and/or commercial) portfolios.

 

What you’re responsible for: 

  • Support development of the agency operation through the sales and profitable growth of life, group and wealth management products.

  • Service and support the life, group and wealth management portfolio of the agency while adhering to compliance rules and regulations for the sale of life insurance and wealth management products.

  • Proactively complete client reviews focusing on life and wealth management products.

  • Prospect and cross sell all lines of business by completing needs analysis for clients in accordance with the agency Business Plan.

  • Complete front-line risk assessment and selection, following underwriting guidelines.

  • Complete home, commercial and farm inspections as required.

  • Develop annual marketing plans outlining strategies and activities to meet goals in each product area of responsibility.

  • Respond to and investigate client questions and concerns, resolve client complaints and escalate issues appropriately.

 

 What to expect: 

  • You will travel occasionally.  

  • You are required to have a valid driver’s license and insurance.  

  • Strict confidentiality with respect to client’s medical history, financial status and other personal information.   

  • Extended work hours, including weekends, may be required during peak periods.  

  • This role involves direct contact with clients and/or service providers in their environment.    

  • You will be subject to a Criminal Record and Consumer History background check as a condition of employment, in the event you are the successful candidate. 

 

To be successful: 

  • You remain focused and optimistic in the pursuit of a goal, despite barriers, until the objective is achieved and allocate time and resources to effectively manage the sales portfolio.  

  • You successfully build plans focused on expanding market penetration and apply an innovative mindset to improve operational efficiencies, with a client centric lens.    

  • You have strong communication skills to influence or persuade others to adopt a specific course of action and can effectively facilitate mutually beneficial solutions.   

  • You build trusting relationships and provide guidance to support the development of peers.  

 

To join our team: 

  • Life License is required.

  • General or other Insurance License(s) may be required depending on the specialty focus for the role.

  • Meet all provincial-licensing requirements in accordance with continuing education in order to obtain and maintain all licenses.

  • You have post-secondary education in a related field.

  • A minimum of two (2) years sales experience or related business or marketing experience is preferred.

  • Knowledge of insurance products and strong underwriting skills is an asset.

 

What we offer:

  • Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Employers.   

  • Opportunities to give back to your community.   

  • A competitive compensation package and benefits program.

title: Client Advisor Wealth Management (Montreal)
description:
Are you an expert in building client relationships? Do you want to bring your wealth expertise and join us in delivering an exceptional client experience?

We’re looking for a client advisor for affluent Montreal clients to:

• manage an existing portfolio of clients in Canada, monitoring investment plans and liquidity for cash needs, and building long-term relationships
• keep accurate and up-to-date client documentation related to risk, compliance and regulations
• provide comprehensive financial advice that meets client needs for investment, enterprise and family living standard
• develop a strategic and tactical development plan, based on understanding of the client’s financial situation, investment objectives and expectations
• grow local market network by referrals and identifying new prospects
• contribute to an effective risk culture by complying with all regulations, policies and standards

title: P3 - Consultant, Hyperion Integration and Financial Planning - Toronto 54236
description:
Are you looking to gain experience within a top 5 bank? Do you have excellent experience on financial planning? If so, this is a great opportunity for you!
Our client, a top 5 bank, is looking for a Consultant, Hyperion Integration and Financial Planning for a six months contract in Toronto. This position is a hybrid remote, 2 days in the office (Wednesday & Thursday), 3 days remote.
High potential for contract extension and conversion as well.
Pay rate: $51.09/hr - $52.86/hr
Rotational shifts: Monday to Friday
Hours per week: 37.5hrs/week


Advantages
● Gain experience working for a leading and globally recognized organization
● Earn a competitive rate within the industry
● Work full time hours on a 6 month assignment with potential for extension
● Hybrid remote work
● Start date is ASAP


Responsibilities
As a Consultant, Hyperion Integration and Financial Planning, your duties will include but not be limited to:
● Collaborating with the existing Analyst
● Working with Forecasters and planners from the Finance support teams
● Reporting to the Senior Consultant, you will support existing Hyperion Planning applications and implement enhancements as the business evolves
● Enabling the sustainment of Finance’s driver-based planning tools by developing and testing logic changes, working with users to document enhancement requirements, trouble-shoot for users as necessary, and provide user training
● Representing the Senior Consultant in interactions with users and external vendors


Qualifications
● A minimum of 2-3 years Hyperion Planning development experience
● A minimum of one year experience developing Hyperion Planning business rules
● Oracle Hyperion Planning certification
● Demonstrable experience of performance tuning techniques including block creation, fix parallel and use of templates to alter the natural order of calculation
● Experience with driver-based module techniques including sales funnel conversion, customer behavior curves and vintage analysis
● Financial modeling experience in a Finance, Planning & Analysis environment in a major bank, particularly tor the balance sheet

Nice to Haves:
● Hyperion Planning development experience in a Financial Institution
● CPA or other Accounting Designation is an asset


Summary
Interested in the Consultant, Hyperion Integration and Financial Planning role in Toronto? Apply online today! Candidates moving towards the next step of the recruitment process will be contacted.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Financial Planner
description:
Financial Planner 
Primary Location: CA-QC-Center of Quebec-Victoriaville  
 
Employee Status: Regular  
 
Schedule: Full-time  
  
 
  • Are you knowledgeable in the seven areas of financial planning?
  • You enjoy building relationships of trust to help your clients and increase their loyalty?
  • You know how to capitalize on business development opportunities?
At National Bank, we truly value the title of Financial Planner. In fact, we pay for our employees to maintain their title and offer them personalized coaching from our Financial Planner Managers.
 
 
Interested in finding out more?
  • Develop financial plans that will meet your client's needs and objectives
  • Identify clients' investment and financing needs to offer them the best financial planning solutions
  • Identify and capitalize on business development opportunities to increase the number of new clients and the volume of existing portfolios
  • Stay on top of clients' changing needs to offer them tailored solutions and a red carpet experience
  • Make sure that service and operational quality standards are applied and compliance and risk management rules are followed
  • The candidate needs to be able to identify all risks inherent to the Personal and Commercial Banking sector’s activities.
 
  • Hold a Bachelor's degree (or equivalent recognized by the IQPF) as well as relevant experience in financial business development and advisory services
  • Hold a Certified financial planner certification (CFP) or be on track to obtain it within the next 12 months
  • Hold a Valid licence of Mutual Fund Sales Representative (MFSRs)
  • Excellent knowledge of French (required) and English (an asset) (spoken and written).

Increase your chances by standing out with a positive attitude, a results-oriented approach and by being collaborative.

The Bank has innovated by modernizing its performance evaluation system to better meet our clients’ evolving needs. From now on, the corporate values (expected behaviors) of partnership, agility and empowerment count as much as the business objectives.

 National Bank sees diversity as a great source of wealth and values it in all its dimensions. Its objective is to offer an open, respectful work environment where all employees can achieve their full potential. Senior management's concrete commitment helps spread this value across all sectors in the organization. The Bank has been ranked among the top employers for diversity in Canada for several years.

At National Bank, we stand out by investing in our employees throughout their careers—as demonstrated when we were awarded silver in the "Most Innovative use of HR Technology" category at the 2020 Canadian HR Awards for our use of Axonify, a personalized learning solution that can be used every day. 

#LI-CP1

 
Particular conditions (external): Important information Once your application has been reviewed, if you're selected to continue the process, you'll receive an email invitation from to answer a Talent Explorer questionnaire. **Please check your spam or junk folder. You'll have 24 hours to complete the questionnaire (takes 15 minutes). Completing the questionnaire is mandatory if you want to continue with the recruitment process. We thank all candidates who show their interest and apply. However, because of the volume of applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted for a first-round interview. Within his function, the candidate will be required to travel to meet clients. Please note that the work schedule may vary according to operational needs.
Job field: Financial planners
Job Posting: May 3, 2022
Unposting Date: May 18, 2022
Work Postal Code: G6P4A1 
Job Number: FIN0097M

title: Senior advisor, financial disclosure
description:
GREAT CAREER OPPORTUNITY AT LOGISTEC

We are the provider of choice for safe, sustainable and creative solutions in the marine and environmental sectors. We are truly committed to finding and supporting the best talent. We are currently seeking to fill the position ofSenior advisor, financial disclosure at our head office located in downtown Montreal.

RELIABILITY         IMAGINATION        GOING BEYOND       SUSTAINABILITY         

With so many opportunities available to you, there are good chances that you’ll find a way of doing what you are truly passionate about. We need top talent to create the right workplace for our people.

Reporting to the Senior Director of Finance, the incumbent will be responsible for the financial statements and will work in collaboration with our external consultants.

Your new responsibilities:

  • Prepare quarterly and annual financial statements under the IFRS accounting framework.
  • Write the quarterly Management Discussion and Analysis in accordance with National Instrument promulgated by the Autorité des Marchés Financiers.
  • Coordinate the preparation of the annual report with all stakeholders including the communications department.
  • Participate to the quarterly and annual budgeting processes, and any other internal financial disclosure processes.
  • Perform technical research and document complex and non-routine accounting transactions.
  • Ensure the implementation and application of internal controls surrounding the financial statement close process.
  • Oversee the accounting of leases under IFRS 16.
  • Need to keep abreast of IFRS developments and identify need for changes to policies and processes as needed.
  • Work with the external auditors to ensure risks are appropriately identified and evaluated.
  • Evaluate the impact of new accounting standards and oversee their adoption in collaboration with internal stakeholders.
  • Act as a key person for the subsidiaries and regional controllers in order to promote continuous education and change management.
  • Provide ad hoc support to the Corporate Director, management and control on various projects.

You have the right qualifications:

  • Professional designation CPA; CA
  • Bilingual (French and English), both orally and in writing.
  • A minimum of 3 to 5 years’ experience in financial accounting, preferably in a large accounting firm.
  • Knowledge of International Financial Reporting Standards (“IFRS”).
  • Possess good communication skills and be a good team player.
  • Strong organizational skills, autonomy, judgment and initiative.
  • Ability to manage priorities while meeting deadlines

If you want to join a great team and have the right qualifications, please visit OUR PEOPLE section of our website at for more information.

title: Consultant - Hyperion Integration & Financial Planning
description:
Client ID: 5218

Consultant - Hyperion Integration & Financial Planning

On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Consultant - Hyperion Integration & Financial Planning

Consultant - Hyperion Integration & Financial Planning – Job Description

  • Reporting to the Senior Consultant, you will support existing Hyperion Planning applications and implement enhancements as the business evolves
  • You will enable the sustainment of Finance’s driver-based planning tools by developing and testing logic changes, working with users to document enhancement requirements, trouble-shoot for users as necessary, and provide user training
  • As required, you will represent the Senior Consultant in interactions with users and external vendors
  • Support the Senior Consultant to drive the Financial Planning process, specifically driver-based forecasting (both revenue & expenses, balance sheet, Treasury metrics, legal entities).
  • Financial modelling experience in a Finance, Planning & Analysis environment in a major bank, particularly tor the balance sheet
  • Work collaboratively with the Central Planning Team and Senior Consultant on general/broad work plans (weekly/monthly/quarterly). Planning is unique and very complex
  • Demonstratable experience of performance tuning techniques including block creation, fix parallel and use of templates to alter the natural order of calculation
  • Experience with driver-based module techniques including sales funnel conversion, customer behaviour curves and vintage analysis
  • Remain closely aligned with the Data & Technology Management team, understanding how Finance is aligned with its data and technology strategy
  • As a key contributor to the business unit, bring a mindset of continuous improvement to recommend enhancements to business processes in order to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness

Consultant - Hyperion Integration & Financial Planning – Mandatory Skills

  • 2-3 years Hyperion Planning development experience
  • 1+ year experience developing Hyperion Planning business rules
  • Oracle Hyperion Planning certification
  • Demonstratable experience of performance tuning techniques including block creation, fix parallel and use of templates to alter the natural order of calculation
  • Experience with driver-based module techniques including sales funnel conversion, customer behaviour curves and vintage analysis
  • Financial modelling experience in a Finance, Planning & Analysis environment in a major bank, particularly tor the balance sheet
  • Good interpersonal skills
  • Ability to train users on the models or application being built
  • Strong Communication Skills (Effectively sharing thoughts and ideas)

Consultant - Hyperion Integration & Financial Planning – Nice to Have Skills

  • Hyperion Planning development experience in a Financial Institution
  • CPA or other Accounting Designation is an asset
  • Excellent verbal and written skills to support regular interaction with Finance and Technology teams
  • Knowledge of Finance (within the context of a Bank) and/or Treasury functions is a significant asset
  • Financial modelling experience in an FP&A environment in a major bank, particularly on the balance sheet

Consultant - Hyperion Integration & Financial Planning - Assignment Start Date

ASAP – 6 months to start

Consultant - Hyperion Integration & Financial Planning - Assignment Location

Toronto, ON – Work Hybrid

title: Coordinator, Financial Empowerment (2022-745-CP)
description:
Employment Type:

1-Year Contract, Bargaining Unit

Work Hours:

35 hours/week, some weekend/evening shifts required

Salary:

G8 - $51,264

Application Deadline:

Open until filled

Program Overview â€“ Financial Empowerment, Community Programs

The Financial Empowerment (FE) Program serves to prevent, reduce, and alleviate poverty by directly addressing the financial barriers in the lives of our clients.  We provide free and unbiased financial counselling, education, and tax filing support to Torontonians who are living on a low income and who are unable to address these issues alone.  We are a program in constant development and expansion, actively pursuing opportunities to explore innovative methods, and produce research on best practices to maximize client impact.

 

The Coordinator, Financial Empowerment will oversee the operation of WoodGreen's free, year-round income tax filing service and develop, coordinate, and facilitate group workshops to clients and professionals on financial topics relevant to living on a low income, and support the development and implementation of new client service innovations within our program.

 

What You Will Do

  • Coordinate the intake/appointment booking functions for the FE and Income Tax services and provide training/oversight to students and volunteers.
  • Perform light-touch financial empowerment interventions with clients (e.g. tax returns, access Notices of Assessment from CRA records, support clients in completing financial applications). 
  • Maintain timely documentation/case notes in program database regarding any direct client services provided, and support volunteers and students in accurate data entry. 
  • In collaboration with other staff, coordinate the scheduling and operation of tax volunteer training and tax clinic service delivery, and provide instruction/oversight to volunteers.
  • Monitor volunteer performance, provide constructive feedback, and conflict resolution.
  • Collaborate with leadership-level volunteers to support skill development of new volunteers, prioritizing high quality and respectful customer service.
  • Develop and facilitate Financial Literacy Workshops to a diverse group of clients on a variety of financial topics relevant to living on a low income (tax filing and benefits access, debt and credit management, budgeting and money management, banking, low-income retirement planning, etc.).
  • Coordinate and maintain schedule of workshop bookings, and book appropriate volunteer support where needed.
  • Perform outreach and networking activities as needed to build relationships with strategic community partners to reach target client groups.
  • Collect attendance records, client feedback forms, and administer research and evaluation surveys with participants.
  • Participate in program planning and development activities.
  • Collaborate with FE Supervisor & FE Manager to develop and execute plans for new client service intake and delivery innovations as part of newly funded projects. 
  • Provide support to other programs looking to connect their clients with FE services.

 

What You Bring to the Team

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Social Work, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • 2 yearsâ€™ experience coordinating program delivery and facilitating workshops in the social services sector.
  • Experience performing intake or outreach with marginalized and vulnerable populations, participation with a Community Volunteer Income Tax Program (CVITP) and/or coordinating a large volunteer program considered an asset.

 

What Will Set You Apart

  • Ability to adjust communication or teaching style to meet the needs of diverse groups of clients facing a variety of personal and systemic barriers.
  • Experience working from a client-centered, anti-oppressive framework.
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Detail-oriented, independent worker with strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Comfortable setting up mobile technology (e.g. laptops, WiFi hub, projector, etc.).
  • Strong computer skills including MS Outlook, Word, Power Point and Excel.
  • Experience working with and mentoring volunteers and students with varied skill sets.
  • Strong understanding of intersectionality of race, age, sexuality, gender, ability, and the associated risks of poverty and homelessness. Those with lived experience of one or several of these dynamics are highly encouraged to apply.
