title: Private Banker
description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

It is banking, the way it should be. At Manulife Bank, we believe banking products are an integral part of every Canadian's financial plan. As one of Canada's youngest banks, we are growing at an unprecedented rate and need people with the skills, energy and drive to maintain our leadership position as an "advisor's bank." We are currently looking for a Private Banker for Toronto.

The Private Banker is part of a team of professionals focused on specialized loan and mortgage solutions to High Net Worth individuals and their families.  The Private Banker is responsible for developing and growing strong relationships predominately within Manulife Financials existing distribution channels with a focus on providing retail mortgage and commercial lending solutions.

Key deliverable for this senior banking role is Relationship Management of a portfolio of HNW clients and their families which includes: conducting broad Discoveries for each client; due diligence on loan and mortgage requests including consumer and commercial analysis; and delivery of a full suite of banking solutions to meet current and future financial needs.

If you have a strong track record providing bank lending solutions to High Net Worth individuals or have a broad banking background that includes commercial banking and you are a self-starter, we would like an opportunity to discuss with you our approach to developing and growing our Private Banking business in Toronto. 

This role will provide an opportunity to convert your strong relationship building skills, banking expertise and drive for results to build a successful business in Toronto.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Expert level of financial analysis of both commercial and personal credit facilities
  • Effective risk management of a banking portfolio including prudent monitoring of overdrafts and credit facilities
  • Develop and grow our already strong partnerships with our distribution channels; comprising of approximately 40,000 Investment and Insurance advisors
  • Collaborate and build partnerships with Bank Account Management, Bank Retail and Business Banking Sales, and Manulife Private Wealth
  • Trusted Advisor to Clients including ongoing Relationship Management of individuals and their Families
  • Coaching and mentoring to junior banking colleagues
  • Provide professional presentations to prospective clients as part of an integrated Deal Team
  • Develop annual, quarterly and monthly business development plans focusing on a clear understanding of goals, run-rates, gaps to plan and key strategies and tactics to close
  • Management of a pipeline and disciplined approach to focusing on critical activities.

Qualifications

  • University Degree or equivalent industry education
  • CSC and or CFP would be beneficial
  • Bilingual (English & Mandarin) an asset
  • Practical application of planning concepts
  • 7+ years of experience in Banking including retail and commercial
  • Creative problem-solving and effective decision-making
  • Consultative with strong presentation and communication skills
  • Achievement oriented with strong networking skills
  • "Win-win" oriented negotiator who builds deep relationships with a client and family and is able to deliver difficult messages when necessary
  • Influence and work collaboratively with banking team in a demanding business environment
  • Ability to adapt to changes, technology and Team priorities
  • Thrives in a rapidly changing and growing business environment
  • Demonstrate initiative and a strong team player

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock and Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact

recruitment@manulife.com

.

title: Account Specialist
description:
Overview:

Axalta Coating Systems Ltd. ("Axalta," or the "Company"), is a leading global manufacturer, marketer and distributor of high-performance coatings systems.â€¯ With over a 155-year heritage in the coatings industry, Axalta is known for manufacturing high-quality products with well-recognized brands supported by market-leading technology and customer service.    

 

Over the course of the Company's history, Axalta has remained at the forefront of the industry by continually developing innovative coatings technologies designed to enhance the performance and appearance of customers' products, while improving the customer's productivity and profitability. Axalta's diverse global footprint of 50 manufacturing facilities, four technology centers, 47 customer training centers and more than 14,000 team members allows the Company to meet the needs of customers in over 130 countries. Axalta serves its customer base through an extensive sales force and technical support organization, as well as through approximately 4,000 independent, locally-based distributors. The Company's scale and strong local presence are critical to its success, allowing leverage of the technology portfolio and customer relationships globally while meeting customer demands locally.  

 

Axalta operates its business in two operating segments: Performance Coatings and Transportation Coatings, serving four end markets, including:â€¯ Refinish, Industrial, Light Vehicle and Commercial Vehicle, across the following four regions: North America, EMEA, Latin America and Asia-Pacific.  

Primary Responsibilities:

The Account Specialist is responsible for maintaining strong customer satisfaction and long-term retention of Axaltaâ€™s customers within a market.   As a member of the Regional sales team the Account Specialist will partner with our coatings customers to foster their long-term success by ensuringthat all elements of the business agreement are delivered.    This is a remote-based role in Greater Toronto Area (ideally located in western side of Toronto).

 

The Account Specialist works with a high sense of urgency and demonstratesâ€¯ownership, commitment, and accountability to Regional and Axalta goals.â€¯  

 

Key Responsibilities:â€¯  

  • Acts as primary point of contact for identified customers and builds strong, collaborative relationships    
  • Understands key elements of the business agreement with each customer  
  • Develops and executes account plans capturing the product, color and services needs of the customer    
  • Understands and accurately communicates the values and benefits of Axalta product, color, and services    
  • Understands and engages the appropriate resources to meet the unique needs of each customer  
  • Maintains an organized communication approach with a regular customer call schedule and clearly documents customer interactions in SalesForce (SFDC)  
  • Follows-up on issues in a timely manner and identifies and advises on process improvements to alleviate roadblocks facing the customer    
  • Effectively prioritize tasks and contributes to regional teamâ€™s expected results for revenue, profitability, customer retention, and distributor management with a high sense of urgency  
  • Provides support on standard operating procedures (SOPâ€™s) and ensures customer is aware of education and support available through Axalta Training Classes and Local Performance Groups  
  • Leads paint conversion efforts and solicits distribution resources to support the customerâ€¯  
  • Maintains accurate account information and contact data in SalesForce (SFDC)  
  • Utilizes appropriate technological resources (SharePoint, Salesforce, MSOffice, etc.) to further individual productivity and enhance communication with co-workers and customers            

#LI-Remote                                  

Minimum Requirements:

An experienced sales professional with Automotive Refinish background and a strong track of successful customer support.â€¯  

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree and/or at least 3-5 years of Automotive Refinish industry experienceâ€¯  
  • Strong knowledge ofthe collisionrepair, commercial transportation and industrial business environment as well as distribution fundamentals    
  • Working knowledge Axaltaâ€™s core product lines and repair shop business fundamentals  
  • Ability to identify customer needs and responds quickly to effectively resolve problems using a collaborative approach    
  • Self-disciplined and able to perform effectively in unstructured and autonomous conditionsâ€¯  
  • Presents oneself in professional manner throughout all levels of the organizationâ€¯and considers how actions will affect customers    
  • Strong team player and actively seeks opportunities to support territory activities and meet customer needs    
  • Demonstrates effective written and oral communication skillsâ€¯  
  • Competent computer skills, proficient with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)â€¯â€¯  
  • Must be willing and able to travel up to 50% of the time

title: Financial Security Advisor
description:
Do you have the entrepreneurist? Help and advise people is a second nature for you? Flexibity in your schedules is a plus and the challenges do not clear you? If we add all this a remuneration at the height of your performances, without ceiling? You answer yes to all these criteria, then you could have your place with us very soon.

As a financial security advisor, you will be called to develop a clientele including:

* You will evaluate the financial needs and for whom you will suggest adapted solutions

* you build financial strategies

* You will help parents finance future studies of their children

* You will secure financial stability in case of difficult and unforeseen moments

* you will facilitate the transfer of wealth and assets to future generations

Beyond the professional side, it's a healthy and friendly environment that awaits you, in which team spirit is particularly put forward and your voice heard. An atmosphere that allows social and professional development.

Indeed, the focus is on team activities and in the agency: '' Team Building '' etc ...

The special situation of the last two years has enabled the financial group to develop a balance between the virtual and the face-to-face, which greatly facilitates family life for those concerned or in the making.

By choosing this career, you will definitely make the difference around you and for you.

title: Associate Investment Advisor
company: DUCA Financial Services Credit Union Ltd.
description:
Associate Investment Advisor

Job Summary

The Associate Investment Advisor will be a licensed Registered Representative who will work closely with and support the Investment Advisor in all aspects of our Wealth Management program, including servicing existing clients and business development. The Assoicate Investment Advisor will be responsible for processing trades, scheduling client meetings, monitoring portfolios and participating in some client meetings.

Accountabilities & Duties

  • Manage daily administrative functions, including communicating with clients, scheduling meetings, and maintain organized client files
  • Act as the first point of contact for clients and respond to client inquiries in a professional and timely manner
  • Regularly monitor client portfolios and assist the Investment Advisor in the overall portfolio management tasks including trade execution, asset allocation reviews and suggested adjustments, and review of equity research on existing stocks in portfolios
  • Coordinate client review meetings and may sit-in or participate in some client review meetings
  • Coordinate and execute marketing initiatives, including events, phone campaigns and print marketing

Experience & Education Requirements

  • 2-5 years of experience in the Investment/Wealth Management industry preferably in a client facing role
  • Post-secondary degree in business, economics or another related field
  • Able to be IIROC registered
  • Completion of Canadian Securities Course (CSC) required
  • Completion of Conduct and Practices Handbook (CPH) or willingness to complete within 90 days of hiring date
  • Completion of Wealth Management Essentials (WME) or willingness to complete within 90 days of hiring date
  • Willing to complete additional industry related designations in the future

Knowledge, Skills & Attributes

  • Strong understanding of capital markets, portfolio management techniques including asset allocation, risk tolerance, equity research
  • Exceptional client servicing and customer service skills
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Passion for investments and desire to learn in career
  • Proven relationship development and management experience
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Experience or familiarity with Datafile, Morning Star Advisor, Plan Plus, and/or Market Q considered an asset

 Working Conditions: Normal Office environment/Hybrid available

Department: Wealth Management

Primary Location: Corporate Office

Employment Status: Full-time

Hours per Week: 38

Job Grade Level: 5

About DUCA

DUCA exists to help people do more, be more and achieve more with their money and their lives. We’re driven by a co-operative philosophy that puts our Members (and Owners) at the centre of every decision we make, gives them a voice in how we’re run, and rewards them for their loyalty by sharing our profits.

At DUCA, we’re dedicated to creating a positive environment where our employees have growth and development opportunities, a healthy work/life balance, opportunities to give back to the community, and a focus on doing what is right for our Members. DUCA offers a competitive total compensation package including base salary, a short-term incentive (bonus) program, a comprehensive benefits program, pension plan, and employee banking benefits.

DUCA is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Recruitment related accommodations will be provided upon request.

Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit their application. Applications must include both a resume and cover letter.

We thank all applicants but only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior Finance Consultant (Contract)
description:
Job Title: Fractional CFO
Industry Sector: Pharmaceutical /Health Care
Duration: 3+ months
Location: Brantford, Ontario

Our health care client is looking for an Senior F&A Consultant to assist the company through a period of internal restructuring. This role will work closely with the CEO, Corporate Controller and the finance team.

About our client
This client brings specialty products to doctors and patients throughout Canada and the USA improving quality of life for their patients. They have their own proprietary products as well as partnering with global companies to deliver a comprehensive line of available products.

About the role
Working closely with the CEO, the Consultant will provide leadership and staff management to the finance department and work closely with other department managers. Along with the Corporate Controller and a staff of 6, you will ensure the group is managing the following:
  • Develop and issue timely monthly consolidated financial reports for owners
  • Drive the complete process for annual budget preparation
  • Deliver quarterly 12-month income statement rolling forecast and cash flow forecast
  • Manage the overall cash flow of the group of companies to ensure liquidity including investment
  • Monitor the foreign currency conversion transactions
  • Manage the ERP system (Dynamics NAV), trouble shooting and security control
  • Interface with outside audit firms, banks, insurance agent, SR&ED consultant, tax consultant, CRA and Stat Canada
  • Coordinate year end working papers (PBCs) for external auditors for the annual audit/review engagement
  • Manage the commodity tax program by regularly reviewing the portfolio of products
  • Manage the SR&ED program by controlling the time tracking system and maintaining adequate document for labor and expenses claim
About the candidate
  • CPA designation and a min 15 years of progressive experience in a leadership role
  • Ability to coach, motivate and develop professional staff
  • Strong technical FP&A capabilities to analyze complicated data
  • Extensive ERP system knowledge is mandatory, Expert user in Excel, Jet Report knowledge a plus
  • SR&ED knowledge an asset, healthcare or pharma industry an asset
Why Apply
This company offers a great environment and people to work with. Plus… their products help improve the quality of life for patients. How awesome is that?!

title: Licensed Mutual Fund Associate Advisor
description:
We are looking for a Mutual Fund Associate Advisor to join our team, in our Chester or Liverpool office, as we seek to achieve lifetime financial security for our clients and help them live healthier lives.  An Associate advisor (AA) is a licensed representative who acts as an Advisor of Record (AoR). The AA is responsible for book of business, and is focused on client relationships, production, and sales activities. The AA can help provide service to the rest of the Employing Advisor’s block.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: 
  • Meet with prospective and existing clients and have a proactive approach to discovering client needs through listening and understanding what they are asking for.
  • Have meaningful Know-Your-Client (KYC) and account opening conversations with your clients as the advisor of Record (AOR).
  • Educate clients by conducting client reviews to provide relevant insights and expert advice that empower clients to make informed decisions.
  • Build client plans using a holistic approach to help them achieve their goals.
  • Collaborate with market-leading business partners in financial planning & retirement planning to ensure clients receive a customized plan and targeted expert advice.
  • Cultivate strong and long-standing relationships.
  • Develop and execute strategic plans on an annual basis to attract new clients.
  • Maintain required license, compliance of ethical behaviors and conformity with corporate policies, industry standards and legal regulations.
  • Deliver an exceptional client experience for current and potential clients according to our service model.
  • Ensure a full balanced calendar of appointments creating sales and service appointments.
  • Help create a smooth, efficient and compliant office.
The successful candidate will be Mutual Fund licensed, have a positive personality and excellent communication skills.  Self motivation and a strong work ethic are a must as well as the ability to work without direct supervision.  
 
We are offering a competitive compensation package with bonuses available to a high performing individual.
 
Interested?  Please send your resume to: jason.kassouf@sunlife.com.
Closing date for applications: March 30, 2022.

title: Financial Planning Coordinator
description:
The Financial Planning Coordinator works to support the existing planners with client meeting preparation, financial plan creation, initial recommendations and acting as a liaison between the head office and client inquiries. Please note that this is not a sales position, and the pay is not based on commissions. It is a support role, and an excellent opportunity for professional development.
 
This is a unique opportunity to join a growing financial planning team and learn from experienced advisors to provide clients with a holistic financial planning experience. 
 
The successful candidate will have experience in the investment and insurance industry with a focus on financial planning and building financial plans.
 
The role is a full-time, salaried position and reports directly to the lead Financial Planner.

Responsibilities:
This position will have a wide variety of responsibilities in many parts of the business including but not limited to:
  • Financial Plan creation, data gathering and entry, initial recommendations, needs analysis, creating quotes and illustrations, identifying opportunities.
  • Assisting with portfolio recommendations and tax planning in conjunction with the client's stated objectives, age and risk level.
  • Professional follow up on new business opportunities.
  • Delivering prompt well-executed resolutions to client inquiries.
  • Anticipate client and Advisor needs and present solutions
  • Help resolve outstanding client issues and service requests.

Skills:
TECHNICAL
  • Intermediate to advanced skills with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Proficiency in Salesforce CRM is an asset
  • Familiarity with investment products
  • Experience with financial planning software
 INTERPERSONAL
  • A self-starter who demonstrates initiative, reliability, and a positive attitude
  • Takes responsibility and ownership for the results of his/her work
  • A team player who supports and works well with fellow office colleagues
 PROFESSIONAL
  • Strong written and verbal skills; ability to communicate in a professional manner
  • Exceptional attention to detail; ensuring accuracy in reports, administrative paperwork and analysis
  • Superb time management skills; able to follow directions, and meet deadlines set by the managing partner as well as governmental deadlines
  • Excellent work ethic; able to work both independently and collaboratively with others
  • Positive overall attitude

Education & Other experience:
  • Completion of or in the process of obtaining the Certified Financial Planning Designation (CFP), Personal Financial Planner (PFP), or similar Financial education, or credentials.
  • Completion of or in the process of obtaining a Mutual Funds or Securities License (Canadian Securities Course) or CIFC (Canadian Investment Funds Course)
  • Completion of or in the process of obtaining an Insurance License in AB through the Life License Qualification Program (LLQP).
  • Experience in a high performing client service-oriented business with a proven track record of under promising and over delivering.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to build trust with clients and team members.

The successful candidate will be driven, have excellent interpersonal skills, telephone etiquette, be outgoing, collaborative, detail oriented and highly organized. A strong aptitude with Microsoft Office and financial planning experience are a must. Salesforce knowledge would be an asset.
 
Salary range: $55,000 - $85,000 based on relevant education and experience.

title: Senior Financial Planner, CFP
description:
Our Wealth Management client is looking for a Senior Financial Planner(CFP) in the Edmonton area to join them. The Team includes a diverse group of financial experts and industry veterans who strive every single day to achieve strong results for their clients. Besides growing their clients’ financial futures, this Firm looks beyond the numbers, offering a human approach, and a commitment to relationship building and the community. Join a high growth Firm with an exciting path forward, with a new digital strategy and brand integration nationally. Let’s talk!
 
The opportunity
• Engage with clients in the discovery process and conduct analysis of raw financial information to provide industry leading comprehensive or modular financial plans.
• Provide exceptional service and strong communication that ensures client retention and leads to client advocacy.
• Through strong partnerships, provide fulsome support and expert guidance with

o Client Portfolio Managers to facilitate expanded relationships with existing and new clients.

o Key experts (legal, accounting, tax) and clients’ advisors to identify the best planning strategies to meet clients’ needs.

o Para-Planning Associates to create operational efficiency and enhance the financial planning experience.
 
• Collaborate with client professional team to ensure plans are implemented properly and efficiently.
• Follow and adhere to the standards set by the Firm’s financial planning framework and FP Canada Standards Council™ Standards of Professional Responsibility.
• Implement programs and procedures to ensure administration is functioning effectively and complies with applicable policies and regulatory requirements in all areas.
• Support the Firm’s training through the creation of financial planning materials; facilitate delivery by different means including webinars, conference calls, etc.
• Actively support the brand and assist in, or lead, creation of client facing financial planning related materials (i.e. articles, documents, reports, blogs).
• Proactively build solid working relationships with the entire Wealth and Financial Group including the Firm’s affiliate brands.
 
Setting you up for Success
The successful incumbent will be an established Financial Planner whose focus is dedicated to building, fostering & sustaining meaningful client relationships. Passionate about working with High Net Worth (HNW) and business owner clients – you are motivated by using financial planning principles and strategies to develop tailored approaches to meet the complex financial needs of clients. Your reputation of ethical & professional behavior is well established. You demonstrate a high level of emotional intelligence, experience, and confidence to work with the clients and their professional advisors in the delivery of financial planning and product solutions. You have excellent presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills and a demonstrated passion for exceptional client service. You are deeply committed to continuous learning and development in financial planning and industry knowledge. You have been looking for the right opportunity!
 
Core knowledge requirements
  • • University degree in a related discipline.
  • • Certified Financial Planner designation required.
  • • Confident and deep understanding of financial planning strategies for HNW and business owners; expert knowledge in tax, estate, and succession planning.
  • • Ability to succeed in a dynamic environment arising from diverse responsibilities, complex processes, multiple stakeholders, and shifting deadlines by utilizing effective prioritization, planning, escalation, and teamwork.
     
    Demonstrated experience
  • • 10 years financial planning industry experience with 5 in a client facing Financial Planning role
 
The Firm
The Firm is an organization with an engaged branch network and unique growth opportunity. They provide discretionary portfolio management as well as a range of financial planning, products, and services. The team is highly collaborative, and they do what is best for clients above all else. The Firm is currently in a high growth phase and has an exciting path forward with a new digital strategy and brand integration nationally

title: Associate Partner- Canada Wealth, Retirement
description:
Posting Description:

Aon is looking for an Associate Partner - Canada Wealth, Retirement

 

Retirement programs have large financial implications for employers. As an Associate Partner, you will be responsible for leading and supporting client teams who are focused on the management of the financial risk of their client's retirement programs.

 

You will have the opportunity to work on a broad and diverse array of clients in both the public and private sector. Working with teams of colleagues you will lead the day-to-day delivery of retirement services. You will also have the opportunity tolead in marketing activities, participate in the development of new service offerings, and to expand your skills through continued learning.

 

As a member of the Aon Wealth Solutions team and a leader of the business, you will also work closely with colleagues in our Commercial Risk, Health and Reinsurance Solutions businesses to bring the best of Aon to address client needs and to help give our clients the clarity and confidence to make better decisions.

Job responsibilities:

  • Lead client relationships for medium to large sized accounts including critical thinking and problem solving; strong second on large complex clients
  • Understands all projects involved with a client and makes sure all needs are being met and proceeding on schedule
  • Can work through larger, more complex projects with little oversight and is responsible for the results, including explanations, presentations, and impact
  • Has mastered many technical concepts and can make reasonable interpretations of how they impact clients, including explanations, presentations and impact
  • Develop and participate in effective oral presentations for existing or prospective clients, individually or in concert with team members
  • Participate in business development activities
  • Proactive in both initiating and leading some discussions internally and externally
  • Coordinate resources on different mandates to achieve client results and collaborate on client activities with other experienced team members
  • Display confidence, passion, and leadership
  • Self-motivated, demonstrates desire to continue to learn and grow, and to go outside oneâ€™s comfort zone
  • Supervise, guide and mentor less experienced colleagues.

You Bring Knowledge and Expertise

  • Required experience:
  • 10+ years of experience in pension plan consulting or related field
  • English written and spoken
  • Organization skills, rigor, and thoroughness
  • Proficient MS Office software (Word, Excel and Power Point)

Education

  • Bachelor's Degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or other related degree
  • Fully qualified actuary (FSA/FCIA)

We offer you

A driven total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:

Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

Aon is committed to ensuring an accessible online application process for all candidates, including individuals with disabilities, by offering an alternative way to apply for job openings. The alternative application method is only available for those who cannot otherwise complete the online application due to a disability or other need for accommodation

Aon provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce.

Disclaimer:

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time

title: Consultant or Senior Consultant - Finance Transformation
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 

The opportunity 


Recognizing the changing and fast-paced professional landscape, you will team with engagement leadership to bring our broad range of capabilities and insights to enhance the role and effectiveness of the Finance function. We are seeking for a Consultant or Senior Consultant to join our Finance Transformation practice. You will be helping clients improve their business and internal finance performance through a focus on providing business advisory services that achieve measurable benefits in operational effectiveness and strategic decision making. 

 

Who We are


A career in our Finance Transformation practice, within Business Consulting services, will provide the opportunity to work alongside Finance leaders to optimize their finance functions. 
We help organizations achieve strategic alignment of their finance organization, implement service and cost improvement initiatives, and embed a performance management process and culture that unite the business around its core objectives.


As a Finance Transformation Consultant or Senior Consultant, you'll actively participate in engagements covering the following expertise areas: 

  • Finance Transformation Strategy & Roadmap 
  • Financial Statement Close & Consolidations
  • FP&A, Controlling Excellence & Management Reporting
  • Finance Operating Model Design
  • Finance & Accounting Process Improvement
  • Global Business Services including Shared Service Centers, Outsourcing. 

 

What you will do

  • Actively participate in client engagements. 
  • Actively contribute for the successful execution of project work. 
  • Actively contribute insight and ideas and assist in drafting high quality project reports
  • Keep abreast of current industry and economic developments relevant to the client's business.
  • Use technology and tools to continually learn and innovate, share knowledge with team members and enhance the delivery of services.
  • Develop, maintain and strengthen client relationships.
  • Actively participate to market development.

 

Skills and attributes for success

  • Display teamwork, integrity and leadership.
  • Strong analytical, interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills. 
  • Demonstrated consistency in values, principles, and work ethic.

 

What you will bring to this role

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, accounting or finance
  • Accounting designation (CPA, CA, CMA or CGA) is an asset
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, able to speak fluently in both french and english
  • Management consulting experience is an asset
  • Working expertise or strong understanding in many, if not all, of the core Accounting areas
  • Experience with ERP and/or Finance transformation implementation projects is an asset
  • Experience with emerging technologies and robotic process automation roll-out is an asset
  • Travel may be required for this role. 
  • Please be advised that this role does not meet the training and experience requirements for those individuals wishing to pursue their Chartered Accountant designation. 

 
What we look for


We are looking for the next generation of outstanding leaders to continue our legacy. Our top performers in the past have demonstrated deep knowledge of the financial services marketplace, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and an ability to adapt and collaborate in changing circumstances. If you are someone who exhibits a strong commitment to lead projects to completion on time and within budget while guiding junior team members through feedback and coaching, then this role is for you.

 

What we offer


At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
  • Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you


Diversity and Inclusion at EY


Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 

EY | Building a better working world 


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Senior Investment Consultant
description:
Posting Description:

Aon Is Looking for a Senior Investment Consultant (Toronto)

As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part of our Investment Consulting business group within Aon, in our Toronto, Ontario Office. As a Senior Investment Consultant, you will report directly to the Local Practice Leader, you will be responsible for delivery of investment consulting material and advice to institutional clients. You will participate in marketing activities intended to develop new investment consulting relationships. You will support a variety of investment consulting projects including designing, coordinating, preparing and delivering analytical consulting assessments. You will be part of our dynamic, results-driven team, which brings experience as strategic consultants and across all asset classes.

Your Impact as a Senior Investment Consultant

Job Responsibilities:

Investment Consulting Services:

  • Providing consulting support services and technical support on a range of advisory and OCIO Investment clients and accounts; including pension and benefit plans (DB and DC), insurance funds, trust and endowment funds, and other special purpose funds;
  • Anticipating client issues, needs or concerns and proactively developing solutions to meet those needs in partnership with the Account Executive/lead Consultants; and
  • Continually reviewing client accounts and relationships and recommending ways to improve the value Aon brings to the client based on a deep understanding of the client's business and insight into industry and investment trends.

Collaboration & Innovation:

  • Raising the profile of Aon;
  • Contributing to the formulation of the marketing strategy for the Investment Consulting Practice;
  • Assisting in preparing and giving effective oral presentations to clients or prospects, as part of a team or individually; and
  • Identifying gaps between client needs and existing Aon Investment Consulting services; proposing and developing service enhancements, adding to Aon's product/service portfolio and intellectual capital.

Contributing to Aon's Talent Management Agenda:

  • Working with other professional advisers, both internally and externally (i.e., record keepers, investment managers, etc.) on institutional investment funds across Canada; and
  • Providing guidance, mentoring and support to junior Investment Consulting colleagues as they serve their clients, ensuring high standards of service.

You Bring Knowledge and Expertise

Required Experience:

  • Minimum of seven (7) years of progressive experience in financial / investment consulting environment;
  • Thorough understanding of institutional investment and investment industry insight and processes. Ideally gained from direct experience in a manager research, fund management, investment consulting or in a plan sponsor role;
  • A strong understanding of investment concepts and the financial markets;
  • Knowledge of the Canadian pension fund market;
  • Proven client relationship management skills; ability to support a book of business;
  • Establish yourself as a trusted advisor;
  • Demonstrate strong client facing skills with the ability to clearly articulate ideas and information and to respond promptly and effectively to all inquiries;
  • Manage an extensive portfolio of diverse Institutional clients, including interaction with C-suite level personnel and investment committees in these client groups;
  • Demonstrated problem solving, analytical decision making, and developing solutions for sophisticated clients/business issues;
  • Adopts entrepreneurial and creative spirit in work through recognizing and capitalizing on opportunities to help with growth and expansion of the organization;
  • Detail and results-orientated; able to work independently on a variety of projects, able to balance multiple priorities in a fast-paced; high pressure environment and meet project deadlines;
  • Strong technical expertise and the proven ability to remain current with respect to investment industry trends, activity in the market, provincial and federal legislative policies and changes;
  • Must be persuasive, forward-thinking, progressive, energetic, and focused;
  • Strong analytical skills; accuracy and attention to detail;
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills;
  • Experienced with Microsoft Office suite of business applications (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint);
  • Some travel required to service clients;
  • A great teammate who can work with a variety of individuals;
  • Collaboration within a matrix environment; and
  • Must have a positive outlook combined with a desire to contribute to the success of Aon.

Education:

  • Bachelor's degree is required, preferably in Finance or Commerce or related specialty, or equivalent years of experience;
  • Commitment to professional development; and
  • Completion of MBA or CFA is preferred.

We offer you

A driven total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:

Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

Aon is committed to ensuring an accessible online application process for all candidates, including individuals with disabilities, by offering an alternative way to apply for job openings. The alternative application method is only available for those who cannot otherwise complete the online application due to a disability or other need for accommodation

Aon provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce.

Disclaimer:

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time

title: Senior Finance Advisor
description:
We are looking for a Senior Finance Advisor, who will play an integral role within the Aluminium Finance team, in the Finance Business Partner Function. This role is based in Kitimat, British Columbia.

This is a great opportunity for a strategic and engaging individual to shape the business strategy and oversee its implementation.

We are an open, connected global team that includes some of the industry’s best and brightest minds. We offer competitive, performance-focused remuneration and a wide range of benefits to reward your contribution. With a global reach, the opportunities to develop and grow your career are broad and exciting.

Reporting to the Finance Business Partner – BC Works, and working a Monday to Friday schedule, you will:
  • Ensure that health and safety is the top priority by following policies and procedures and always acting in a safe manner
  • Work alongside operational teams to help the site manage business performance: to assist in the plan execution while tracking against actual expenses; to identify threats and opportunities; and to offer guidance and stimulate ideas for forecasts
  • Simplify and communicate financial information across the site with a clear focus on empowering employees at all levels and making them proactive in their decision making
  • Focus on value creation and optimization opportunities and ensure initiatives are properly carried out
  • Coordinate reporting on cost management and value creation
  • Analyse and interpret financial results to address the right levers for maximizing value
  • Prepare and review financial models to evaluate the business case for financial investments
  • Participate in budget setting and forecasting
  • Assist the company in targeting the most profitable initiatives to maximize value
  • Oversee compliance with internal financial controls, while maintaining high ethical standards

title: Certified Financial Planner
description:
Meet Moka

Moka is on a mission to help people achieve their financial goals. The Moka app makes it easy for everyone to save by automatically rounding up their purchases and investing the spare change, but roundups are just the beginning. To help our users across all aspects of their financial lives, we use data to develop personalized insights, recommendations and services.

Now, we are looking for more great people who want to be part of a high-energy startup reshaping the financial services industry. If you want to work with talented people, solve big problems and make life better for hundreds of thousands of people, in Canada and beyond, come join us at Moka.

The Role: Financial Planner

Our mission is to help millennials achieve their financial goals. Our users have questions about everything from paying down debt, to reducing their cell phone bills. We're looking for a Financial Planner to listen carefully to our users, understand their needs, and provide the right advice.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Helping users with questions about their financial lives, ranging from debt to saving, spending, or retirement.
  • Managing high-volume inbound support channels: you are part of the first line of defense in making sure our users receive the attention and care they need, in a timely manner. Main support channel is chat-based, with occasional phone support required.
  • Document topics in our internal support tools as they arise.
  • Build trust and rapport by keeping users in the loop and resolving issues quickly and thoroughly

Qualities

  • Knowledge of Personal Finance: you can confidently respond to questions about financial concepts across a wide range of topics.
  • Problem Solving: you are curious and ask the right questions to quickly solve problems and provide the right advice to users.
  • Organization: you can handle multiple users at once and see them through to completion.
  • Communication: you are a great writer, can adjust your tone and formality to fit the situation, and are empathetic and patient with people.
  • Collaborating: you have a unique insight to our users’ needs and work with our marketing, product and development teams to help inform, design and implement solutions.

Requirements

  • Bilingual English/French
  • Strong written communication skills
  • Analytical skills
  • Passion for personal finance
  • CFP designation

Bonus

  • Start-up experience
  • Financial planning experience


Why Moka?

Moka has been downloaded over 900,000 times by people looking for an easy and intelligent way to save and invest, many for the very first time.

We’ve been featured in major media across the country, won a deal on Dragons’ Den, and acquired an asset management firm with over $120M AUM. Our CEO Phil Barrar was nominated for EY Entrepreneur of the Year, made the Bay St Bull’s 30<30 List, and has raised $14M in funding to date, most notably from NAVentures, the venture capital division of National Bank of Canada, and Desjardins Capital, the venture capital arm of North America's largest association of credit unions.

What We Offer

In a short time, our team has grown from just a few to nearly 70 people. At Moka, we value making an impact, asking the tough questions and being inclusive. Our people and their passion are what truly set us apart.

  • Comprehensive health benefits package
  • Generous vacation policy as well as flexible work hours and location
  • Support for continuing your skills development, developing your industry knowledge and achieving your career and personal development goals
  • A casual environment where you will work with smart and passionate people


We believe in being an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate diversity and differences of perspectives at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Financial Advisor
company: Desjardins Financial Security Independent Network - Rexdale #278
description:
BECOME A PART OF OUR SUCCESS STORY

At Desjardins, we are a Canadian leader in the life insurance and financial services industry and due to our exceptional growth; we are looking for highly motivated individuals to join our network at our Desjardins financialcentre in Etobicoke asan Advisor/Brokerfor life insurance, living benefits, group insurance and a full range of mutual and/or segregated funds.

Desjardins is a team that prides ourselves on our excellent company culture, our very clean and safe working environment, and our commitment to being an equal opportunity company

As a Financial Advisor, you will provide sound financial advice for both the protection of and the growth of your clients, while you build your business with the support of one of the strongest financial institutions in North America

Responsibilities

  • Source, build and retain your client base
  • Market yourself and your business to attract new clients
  • Provide insurance needs advice based on risk assessment
  • Provide sound financial advice to help grow your client’s financial portfolio
  • Understanding of your individual clients needs based on their unique circumstances

Requirements – must have

  • At Least 2 years with Mutual Fund License – IFIC or CSC
  • Ability to work independently as well as part of a team
  • Desire to build your own successful business
  • Life insurance sales experience
  • Ability to source new client leads.
  • Develop and build client relationships
  • Strong networking abilities

Requirements - Nice-to-have

  • HLLQP (Harmonized Life License Qualification Program)

What We Offer:

  • A complete portfolio of insurance and investment products from numerous Canadian insurance and investment companies. (Including Desjardins, Mackenzie, Fidelity, TD, CI, Dynamic, etc as well as Insurance through Desjardins, RBC Insurance, Canada Life, Manulife, IA, Empire, CPP, and many more)
  • Vesting/ ownership of renewals and ownership of clients from the first day of contract.
  • Continuous training and education in insurance, investments and sales.
  • Recognition and rewards for outstanding performance.
  • Office or workstation support with administration support. – no mandatory occupancy charges
  • Negotiable and generous commission/overrides


Interested individuals are invited to apply directly to Orlando Ali at

oali@dfsin.ca

http://www.dfsinrexdale.com/careers/

http://www.dfsinvestmentinsurance.ca/en/career/

Desjardins Insurance in numbers [1]

  • More than 5 000,000 clients in Canada
  • 4 700 employees
  • Total revenues of nearly $6.0 billion

Awards

  • Namedseventh BestCorporate Citizen in Canada by Corporate Knights, marking Desjardins’ fifth consecutive appearance in this ranking (As of December 31, 2016.)
  • Canada’s Top50 Best Employers (AON, 2016)
  • Canada’s Top 100 Employers (Mediacorp, 2016)
  • Canada’s Top Family-Friendly Employers (Mediacorp, 2016)

Details

  • Location:406- 155 Rexdale Blvd, Etobicoke Ontario
  • Job Type:Full time - Independent
  • Compensation:FullCommission
  • License Required
  • IFIC/CSC,
  • LLQP (Optional)

Desjardins Financial Security Investments Inc. (DFS Investments) is a corporate body separate and apart from Desjardins Insurance.1

title: Wealth Management Advisor
description:
Wealth Management Advisor, Windsor, Chatham-Kent, Ontario


RECRUITING ROOM Financial Division
LOCATION Windsor/Chatham Region

MIGHT BE A GOOD FIT IF YOU ARE:
  • Financial Advisor (Wealth Management) OR,
  • Sales Marketing Experience
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Meet the sales goals and targets as set out by our client
  • Provide product and service knowledge to customers
  • Proven sales abilities and can demonstrate their currently monthly sales volumes
  • Experience with prospecting, cold calling and closing
  • Leadership ability and team building skills
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Well-developed problem solving skills and ability to develop conceptual alternatives
  • High degree of resourcefulness, flexibility, and adaptability
  • Must have the ability to plan, organize, develop, implement and interpret the programs, goals, objectives, policies, procedures, etc.
  • Must have a valid drivers' license
  • Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident (licensing purposes)
  • No criminal record
  • Must be a resident of Windsor or Chatham Regions for at least 6-months
PAY
  • Pay is negotiable - based on level of experience
ADDITIONAL INFO
When you apply for this position you give the Recruiting Room permission to share your information with other team members and our network of employers.You further acknowledge that the Recruiting Room is a free service to all candidates and as such, furtheragree to indemnify and hold harmless Recruiting Room from any allegations, claims, actions, suits, demands, damages, liabilities, obligations, losses, settlements, judgments, costs and expenses (including without limitation attorneys’ fees and costs) that result from the sharing of this data.

You further acknowledge, and give consent, for the Recruiting Room to check your previous employers (to make a hiring decision), if you fail to provide references before the point of offer.We only ask questions that are “reasonably required,” for our employers to assess the applicant’s fitness for the job.We DO NOT contact current employers.

You further acknowledge, by applying for this position, you allow the Recruiting Room, and its agents, to contact you via SMS Messaging (texting), Facebook, Instagram or any other forms of social networking.

title: Senior Advisor, Pension Plans (Montreal Dorval, QC, CA)
description:
Senior Advisor, Pension Plans-MON18089

Description

BOMBARDIER

Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy efficeincy, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

In your role, you will:

- Manage actuarial valuations in Canada and USA

- Participate in the organization of various committees in Canada and USA and produce required material

- Work closely with finance and the consolidating actuary for gathering and providing pension related information for quarterly and year-end financial statements

- Calculate monthly employer contributions to Canadian pension plans

- Ensure pension plans around the world remain compliant with local legislation and be responsible for governance activities related to pension plans (plan amendments, notice to members, government filing, pension plans financial statements in Canada and USA, etc.)

- Support union negotiations in Canada and USA and work closely with the business and external providers

- Participate to the development of educational material related to pension plans.

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

- You have five to ten years of relevant experience in pension plans in Canada (actuarial valuations, design, modifications and pension accounting) within a consultancy, a corporate office, or a multinational company
- You hold a bachelor’s degree in actuarial science or mathematics
- Be an Associate, Canadian Institute of Actuaries or AICA
- You have a superior capacity for strategic analysis and very detail-oriented
- You are able to perform high quality work within tight deadlines and in a high-pressure environment
- You demonstrate initiative and good judgment
- You have an excellent mastery of French and English, both spoken and written, and you are a strong communicator
- You have excellent knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)

Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigation status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.

Whether your candidacy is moving on to the next step of the hiring process or not, we will keep you informed by email or by phone.

Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

title: Grain Trader (Organic / IP grains)
description:
Company Overview 

Targray is a diversified multinational commodity and specialty materials company that markets a broad range of products and solutions for high-growth energy sectors. Established in 1987 in Montreal, Canada, our organization is a leading international provider of materials for solar and energy storage companies, and one of the largest physical traders and distributors of Biodiesel fuel in North America. 

Targray has operations in 9 countries and over $500M USD in annual sales. In 2019, the company made its debut appearance on the FP500, Financial Postâ€™s ranking of the top 500 corporations in Canada by revenue. 

  • Great Place to Work QuebecÂ® Certified (2021)â€¯ 

  • Great Place to WorkÂ® Certified (2020) 

  • Deloitte | Best Managed Companies (2019) 

  • EY Canada | Quebec Entrepreneur of the Year (2016) 

  • HSBC | International Business Award (2012) 

  • Profit 100 Fastest-Growing Companies in Canada (2006, 2009) 

Job Summary 

We are in the process of building an Organic / IP grain trading desk.â€¯ â€¯We are looking for a Grainâ€¯Traderâ€¯with experience in trading Organic, Identity Preserved, and/or Non-GMO Grains and Pulses.â€¯The Grain Trader should have experience originating and/or selling these products.â€¯ Location can be in any Targray office worldwide, or home based.

Requirements 

  • Proof of a successful and profitable track record on a physical trading desk. 

  • 3 yearsâ€™ experience in commodities trading and exposure to the relevant producers and end-users. 

  • Excellent communication skills 

Employee Benefits 

  • Highly competitive remuneration 

  • Generous profit-sharing package 

  • Medical and Dental Insurance 

  • Targray offers flexibility in terms of the location of the trading desk. 

Targray provides a highly competitive remuneration plan and an excellent working environment in a growing multinational firm focused on creating a more sustainable global economy. For more information about our company, please visitâ€¯https://www.targray.com/

title: Financial Service Representative (FT Permanent)
description:
easyfinancial has been providing personal loans since 2006. With over 400 branches across Canada, we are a leading provider of financial products and services, including unsecured consumer loans, prepaid cards and credit repair products that cater to underserved Canadians that do not have access from traditional financial institutions.

This role offers ahighly competitiveBase Pay + Monthly Performance Bonus!

So what will you do as a Financial Service Representative?

  • You will build superior customer sales experiences by engaging, listening and understanding the financial needs of potential customers and matching their needs to our lending solutions in a pleasurable sales environment
  • You will demonstrate compassion and empathy toward customers to be able to hear their story and help with the most appropriate sale of our financial services based on individual needs
  • You will welcome and engage customers visiting your branch location or by actively prospecting new clients through a combination marketing and outbound sales call activity with a view to achieving and exceeding branch sales targets
  • You will capitalize on financial cross-sales and add-on products by paying attention to customer needs to specifically pinpoint sales opportunities while clearly and openly communicating the terms and conditions of our financial products
  • Review and evaluate online financial loan applications, assess the applicants’ credit worthiness, perform financial analysis, and other risk assessments to improve quality of the sale and limit future collection items
  • Manage collections activities for all past due financial accounts, maintaining an impeccable level of service
  • Accurately secure all required information to fulfill customer applications for products and maintain information and records to limit errors

What we are looking for:

  • People Oriented, Enterprising and an excellent communicator with the ability to build memorable customer experiences for every financial sale
  • Proficient with PCs, Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and Outlook), strong keyboarding skills and an ability to learn and master new software programs
  • Ability to multi-task, adapt to change in a dynamic sales environment
  • Achievement and results oriented with a positive personality to drive sales and increase customer happiness
  • Insightful, compassionate and operate with integrity with every sale – care deeply for our customers!

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

goeasy is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, goeasy is committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with all legislative requirements throughout Canada. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability and we will work with you to address your needs.

Additional Information:

To be considered for hire, you will be need to successfully pass a criminal background check, credit check, and validation of your work experience.

Selected candidates will participate in a company paid/sponsored training program for 2 weeks. This training program may require some travel for the 2 weeks. 

We thank all interested applicants, however we will only be contacting those for interview who possess the skills and qualifications outlined above.

Why should you work for goeasy?

http://goeasy.com/careers/

title: Investment Banking Internship - Montreal
description:
Investment Banking Intern

Seeking a hardworking undergraduate or recent graduate passionate about investment banking. You may get involved with analysing markets, creating complex financial models, producing prospectuses and performing valuation. 

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Conduct market research and building discounted cash flow model
  • Preparing in-depth valuations and other financial analysis
  • Calculate financial metrics, assisting with the annual business plan and budgeting process
  • Construct financial statements in Excel, and preparing M&A reports
  • Underwrite models to reflect asset performance and changes in the market environment
  • ï»¿Critical analysis of financials and business data
  • ï»¿Communicate financial patterns, insights and discrepancies

Qualifications and Skills

  • Student in penultimate year, final year or recent graduate (graduated within last 3 years). 
  • Strong academics in business, accounting, economics, finance. Will consider other degrees.
  • Cross cultural work experience a plus
  • Working knowledge of Excel, Power Point and Word
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong presentation skills; oral and written

Benefits and Perks

  • Remote opportunity available
  • A dedicated mentor will be offered to guide you as you progress through your journey. 
  • Unparalleled early exposure and acquiring strong financial analysis skills.
  • This is a competitive unpaid role which provides academic credits and direct experience.

title: Financial Services Agent - Clientele
description:
(Work place: Rivière-Rouge)

Desjardins values diversity and equity in the workforce and is committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities by adapting the recruitment process, as needed.

Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

Job Level

NV-04

As a client financial services agent, you work closely with advisors and provide personalized support to members and clients. You help advisors deliver services and maintain business relationships. You draw on your interpersonal savvy and communication skills to ensure member/client satisfaction and service quality in accordance with the organization’s standards and procedures.

You provide significant business development support. You assist members and clients, providing excellent customer service.

You create offers for routine transactions, and help sell products and services based on the needs of members and clients and current strategies and practices. You tailor your approach based on members’ and clients’ needs.

General Information on the Position

Caisse Desjardins de la Rouge is located in Rivière-Rouge. The Caisse has 35 employees in 4 service centres serving 11 369 members. Its assets total $314,2 million and its total financing (caisse and components) is $265,2 million. The Caisse has a total of $270 million in savings.

Main responsibilities

  • Handle client requests. Perform tasks and research as needed, and recommend appropriate solutions.

  • Help colleagues manage their agenda and emails.

  • Be attentive to the needs of members and clients and recommend solutions that meet their needs and expectations.

  • Help members and clients choose and get the most of their tools and channels based on how much independence and automation they want.

  • Seize business opportunities and participate in sales development initiatives.

Other working conditions

  • Workplace:        The work arrangement for the position is full-time on-site work #LI-Onsite

  • Number of jobs available : 1

Qualifications

  • Attestation of Collegial Studies

  • A minimum of 2 years of relevant experience

Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered

  • Hold a mutual fund representative certificate – Autorité des marchés financiers

  • For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required

Specific knowledge

  • Understanding of financial documents used in asset management

  • Knowledge of all products and services aimed at caisse members and those offered by Desjardins business centres, components and distribution networks, as well as those of competitors

  • Knowledge of integrating financial data into systems

  • Knowledge of compliance with An Act respecting the distribution of financial products and services

  • Understanding of the philosophy and fundamentals of financial services cooperatives

  • Knowledge of operating procedures related to investment and financing activities

  • Knowledge of operating procedures related to convenience products and services and automated and assisted transactions

  • Knowledge of operating procedures related to opening accounts, the selling of additional products and services, and Accord D financing

  • Knowledge of the Desjardins business processes (e.g. sales, solicitation and negotiation)

  • Knowledge of service standards

Desjardins Cross-sector skills

Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning

Key competencies for the job

Communicates effectively, Interpersonal Savvy, Situational adaptability

Work Location

7531, boul. du Curé-Labelle Labelle

Trade Union

Non Syndiqué

Unposting Date

2022-05-16

Job Family

Member/client sales and service (FG)

title: Financial Services Officer
company: DUCA Financial Services Credit Union Ltd.
description:
Financial Services Officer 

We are looking for a new Financial Services Officer to join our dynamic Willowdale branch!

Branch Hours:
Mon to Wed: 9:30 am to 5:00 pm                           
Thurs: 9:30 am to 7:00 pm
Fri: 9:30 am to 5:00 pm 
Sat: 9:30 am to 1:00 pm

Job Summary

The Financial Services Officer (FSO) plays a key role in helping our Members to do more, be more, and achieve more with their money and their lives. The FSO establishes relationships with Members, understands their goals, and provides them with holistic financial advice on a range of DUCA products and services that will enable them to achieve these goals. The FSO also helps develop new business with existing and potential Members through participation in branch campaigns and events, and establishing relationships within the community.

The FSO is a senior member of our small branch advisory teams and is responsible for providing leadership and coaching to other team members in the absence of the Branch Manager.

Key Accountabilities & Duties

  • Establish strong relationships with Members and ask open-ended questions to discover Members’ life events, financial situation, risk profile, and short- and long-term goals.
  • Proactively provide needs-based advice by developing and presenting customized financial solutions that will help Members achieve their goals
  • Utilize sound interviewing, judgement and analysis skills to identify and provide recommendations on credit solutions within guidelines, on products including mortgages, loans, lines of credit and credit cards
  • Provide sound investment advice and identify appropriate solutions including registered and non-registered term deposits, TFSA’s, mutual funds, and other wealth solutions. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of economic and market conditions.
  • Open new Member accounts and provide other banking solutions to meet Member needs
  • Generate referrals for more complex needs to our Commercial or Wealth Management teams
  • Provide exceptional Member service by developing and deepening relationships, maintaining regular communication, and providing timely responses and value-added information and advice to Members
  • Work towards achieving or exceeding individual and branch objectives, while always acting in the best interest of our Members
  • Identify opportunities to develop business within the community and attract new Members to DUCA by establishing “centres of influence” outside the branch, and participating in community and branch events as a representative of DUCA
  • Complete and process all work within guidelines and in accordance to compliance, audit, policies, and procedures

Occupational Experience & Education Requirements

  • Post-secondary education
  • A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a financial services sales environment and a minimum of 1 year in an advisory role with a proven track record in sales
  • Mutual funds license (e.g. IFIC), or working towards obtaining a mutual funds license
  • Experience working with or knowledge of a range of credit and investment products

Knowledge, Skills & Attributes

  • Passionate about providing excellent Member service and helping others to achieve their goals
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong relationship management skills
  • Strong business acumen and financial industry knowledge
  • Proven sales skills; results-oriented
  • Strong attention to detail and time management skills
  • Experience using Microsoft Office suite of products
  • Experience using Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Loan Originating System (LOS), or other related software, considered an asset
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Dedication to continual learning and development

Department: Retail Banking

Primary Location: Willowdale Branch – 5290 Yonge Street, Toronto, ON, M2N 5P9

Employment Status: Full-time

Hours per Week: 38

Job Grade Level: 5

About DUCA

DUCA exists to help people do more, be more and achieve more with their money and their lives. We’re driven by a co-operative philosophy that puts our Members (and Owners) at the centre of every decision we make, gives them a voice in how we’re run and rewards them for their loyalty by sharing our profits.

At DUCA, we’re dedicated to creating a positive environment where our employees have growth and development opportunities, a healthy work/life balance, opportunities to give back to the community, and a focus on doing what is right for our Members. DUCA offers a competitive total compensation package including base salary, a short-term incentive (bonus) program, a comprehensive benefits program, pension plan, and employee banking benefits.

To learn more about DUCA please visit our website at https://www.duca.com/.

DUCA is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Recruitment related accommodations will be provided upon request.

Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit their application. Applications must include both a resume and cover letter. We thank all applicants but only those considered for an interview will be contacted.
